credit_opinion.summary: CABB is a CHALLENGED B3/B rated specialty chemicals credit with elevated distress score (15). Credit reports explicitly note 'persistent cash burn, soft end-market demand and pricing pressures.' The company is in operational restructuring mode - closing Knapsack site and selling Jayhawk business for $150m to shore up liquidity. While bonds trade near par (99-100) and May 2028 maturities provide runway, the fundamental trajectory is concerning. Permira has owned since 2014 - a 10+ year hold that suggests significant exit challenges. Yields of 7.9-8.8% reflect B-rated risk premium.
